definition: between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: To succeed in the world we must look foolish but be wise.
sentences.chinese: 要在人世間取得成功，我們心須大智若愚。

sentences.english: There is a limit to the amount of creative talent available in the world.
sentences.chinese: 人世間的創造力是有一定限度的。

sentences.english: Innocence are the most valuable things in the human world, we rectifiable is it.
sentences.chinese: 純真是人世間最可貴的東西，我們可求的就是它。

sentences.english: Fortune reigns in gifts of the world, not in lineament of nature .
sentences.chinese: 命運之神是人世間恩惠的主宰，不能支配自然的相貌。

sentences.english: He lives a turbulent life and has experienced many difficulties in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他一生坎坷，經歷過人世間許多苦難。

sentences.english: Let me more happy, also be to the human world trip.
sentences.chinese: 讓自己多點開心點，也不枉爲來人世間旅行一趟。

sentences.english: Innocence are the most valuable things in the human world, is it our rectifiable .
sentences.chinese: 純真是人世間最可貴的東西，我們可求的就是它。

sentences.english: It is useless to rant and rave at the injustices in the world.
sentences.chinese: 對人世間不公平的事靠罵大街是沒有用的。

sentences.english: A hero dies for the man who knows him.
sentences.chinese: 人世間有百媚千紅，我卻獨愛你這一種。

sentences.english: He was one of the most exhausting conversationalists that ever lived.
sentences.chinese: 他是人世間最健談的人之一。

sentences.english: The sorrow of all sorrows is the ignorance of one's ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 人世間最大的悲哀，莫過於對自身的無知渾然不知。

sentences.english: When it comes to human affairs, everything is paradoxical.
sentences.chinese: 說到人世間的事，一切都是似是而非的。

sentences.english: The grey rain-curtain of this world rolls back, and all turns to silver glass, and then you see it.
sentences.chinese: 當人世間的灰色雨幕拉開，所見將是一片銀白透明。

sentences.english: As summer goes and winter comes, I have been to earth through a dozen Mid-Autumn festival.
sentences.chinese: 寒來暑往，我已於人世間渡過了十幾個中秋節了。

sentences.english: Money can be used to support God’s work on earth.
sentences.chinese: 錢可以用來支持上帝在人世間的活動。

sentences.english: In the world, a man who would make his way, must plague and bestir himself night and day.
sentences.chinese: 要在人世間成功進取，須日日夜夜發奮磨練。

definition: to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
to worry about/to be concerned about
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
variant of 輪迴|轮回[lun2 hui2]
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
in the end/after all is said and done
